result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy R Hellinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain Domestic Violence assessment through a certified (WBTP) Wisconsin batterer's treatment provider and followthrough with all treatment recommendations.
No contact with Carol P. unless approved by Agent.
Submit DNA sample.

DA moves to amend Count 1 to a DC-DV 947.01(1).  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty as amended.  No victim input.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court orders 5 days jail imposed & stayed, 18 months probation with conditions.

provided to the Def. in court.

Defendant Billy R Hellinger in court with Attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weerts addresses the court. Def. is seeking amendment to his bond to allow Marvin Beachy to pick up his mail from the victim's address. Atty. Parker doesn't object however, he wants the court to order the Def. to file a "change of address" at the post office today. Court modifies the bond to allow Marvin Beachy to pick up the Def.'s mail at victim's address and orders the Def. to file a "change of address" form at the post office today. All other bond conditions remain in full effect.
